nodes.text: Mynock Minute was a fathier colt owned by Ubbla Mollbro. Mynock Minute was born to the sire and dame Doonium Strike and Take Flight in 31 ABY. He participated in fathier races at Canto Bight racetrack. Ridden by jockey Xis Gabbard, Mynock Minute participated in a race that took place shortly before the Battle of Crait.

Mynock Minute was one of several possible names offered by Lucasfilm Story Group member Pablo Hidalgo to director Rian Johnson for use in Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi. The other options were Hoth Stuff and Kessel Runner. Johnson chose Hoth Stuff. The names "Mynock Minute" and "Kessel Runner" were later used in the novella collection Canto Bight and the replica journal The Last Jedi: Rose Tico: Resistance Fighter.
